  • If you fall off while more than 10 feet in the air, you fall unless you have another means of flight

This is the iconic witch spell, and most witches learn it early. See the Witch's Broom magic item for a permanent version.

Green Transformation (4th Circle)

School: Transmutation
Casting Time: 1 hour
Range: Touch
Components: V, S, M (Green Elixir worth 500oz)
Duration: Permanent

You administer Green Elixir to one willing humanoid, transforming their skin to a vibrant green color. This grants:

  • +2 to Charisma (maximum 20)
  • Advantage on saving throws against enchantment spells
  • The ability to cast one additional spell of 3rd level or lower per day
  • Permanent green skin (cannot be disguised by mundane means)
  • Social stigma—most people fear green-skinned individuals as witches

This transformation is irreversible except through wish or similar powerful magic. Green skin is strongly associated with powerful blood witches like Elphaba.

Curse of Binding (3rd Circle)

School: Necromancy
Casting Time: 1 minute
Range: Touch
Components: V, S, M (a lock of the target's hair or drop of blood)
Duration: Until dispelled

You place a curse on one creature you touch (Wisdom save to resist). Choose one of the following effects:

  • Weakness: Disadvantage on ability checks and saves using one ability score
  • Vulnerability: Disadvantage on saves against one type of magic (enchantment, evocation, etc.)
  • Misfortune: Once per turn when the target rolls a 20, it must reroll and take the second result
  • Compulsion: The target feels compelled to perform or avoid one specific action (GM discretion on reasonableness)

The curse lasts until removed with remove curse or greater restoration. A witch who dies with active curses causes those curses to become permanent.

Summon Familiar (1st Circle)

School: Conjuration (ritual)
Casting Time: 1 hour
Range: 10 feet
Components: V, S, M (charcoal, incense, and herbs worth 10oz burned in a brass brazier)
Duration: Instantaneous

You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes an animal form: bat, cat, crab, frog, hawk, lizard, octopus, owl, poisonous snake, fish, rat, raven, sea horse, spider, or weasel. Your familiar:

  • Acts independently but obeys your commands
  • Can't attack but can take other actions
  • You can communicate telepathically within 100 feet
  • You can see through its eyes and hear through its ears as an action
  • When it drops to 0 HP, it disappears but can be resummoned

Your familiar might be a normal animal bound to you, a nature spirit, or (for Pact witches) a minor demon or fey creature.

Witch Sight (2nd Circle)

School: Divination
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: Self
Components: V, S
Duration: 10 minutes

Your eyes become pools of shadow as you gain magical sight. For the duration, you can see:

  • Invisible creatures and objects
  • Into the Ethereal Plane (10 feet)
  • Magical auras around creatures and objects (as detect magic)
  • Shapechanged creatures in their true form
  • The true emotional state of creatures (seeing through deception)

While using Witch Sight, your eyes appear completely black, which can frighten the superstitious.

Blood Magic Ritual (5th Circle)

School: Necromancy (ritual)
Casting Time: 10 minutes
Range: Self
Components: V, S, M (your own blood)
Duration: Instantaneous

You cut yourself (taking 2d6 necrotic damage that cannot be reduced or prevented) and use your blood to fuel a more powerful spell. Choose one spell of 4th level or lower that you know. You can cast it without expending a spell slot. Additionally:

  • The spell's save DC increases by 2
  • Damage dice are maximized (don't roll, use maximum value)
  • Duration is doubled if the spell has one

After using Blood Magic Ritual, you cannot regain hit points from magical healing until you complete a long rest. Your maximum HP is also reduced by the damage taken until you complete a long rest.

GM Note: Blood magic is dangerous and corrupting. Frequent use should have narrative consequences.

Read the Grimmerie (7th Circle)

School: Divination
Casting Time: 1 hour
Range: Self
Components: V, S, M (the Grimmerie or a page from it)
Duration: Instantaneous

You attempt to decipher and cast a spell from the legendary Grimmerie, the ancient book of dangerous magic. Make an Intelligence (Arcana) check:

  • DC 15: You successfully cast one spell of 5th level or lower from the book
  • DC 20: You cast one spell of 7th level or lower
  • DC 25: You cast one spell of 9th level
  • Failure by 5+: The spell backfires catastrophically (GM discretion)

Casting from the Grimmerie is dangerous. Even on success, you must make a Wisdom save (DC 15) or gain one point of corruption (GM tracks separately). The Grimmerie contains spells that don't exist in other traditions, including spells for:

  • Creating life
  • Altering time
  • Transferring souls
  • Reality manipulation

Only the most powerful witches dare attempt this spell.

Cultural Significance

Witch magic is feared and persecuted throughout Oz:

  • Illegal: Practicing witchcraft is a capital crime in most regions
  • Hereditary: Witch abilities often run in families, leading to family persecution
  • Diverse: No two witches practice exactly the same magic
  • Morally Complex: Witch magic has no inherent alignment—it can heal or harm, create or destroy
  • The Green: Green-skinned witches are especially feared and powerful

Learning Witch Magic

Unlike other traditions, witch magic usually cannot be "learned" in the conventional sense:

  • Blood Witches: Born with power, often manifests at puberty or during emotional trauma
  • Pact Witches: Power granted through bargain with otherworldly entity
  • Learned Witches: Self-taught through experimentation, study of forbidden texts, or apprenticeship with another witch (Kumbric tradition)

Someone without innate witch potential can become a witch through a pact or by dedicating themselves to learning hedge magic, but it's dangerous and difficult.

GM Notes

Witch Persecution

Playing a witch in Oz should be dangerous:

  • Public spellcasting can lead to arrest or mob violence
  • Green skin makes disguise nearly impossible
  • Witch hunters actively search for practitioners
  • Even sympathetic NPCs may fear witches

Power and Corruption

Consider implementing corruption mechanics for witches who:

  • Frequently use blood magic
  • Read from the Grimmerie
  • Break their pact terms (for Pact witches)
  • Use magic to cause deliberate harm to innocents

Corruption might manifest as: physical changes (more green skin, black veins, glowing eyes), personality shifts, or loss of empathy.

Famous Witches

The most powerful witches in Oz's history include:

  • Elphaba Thropp - The "Wicked Witch of the West"
  • Nessarose Thropp - The "Wicked Witch of the East"
  • Glinda Upland - The "Good Witch" (though her magic is more Adept-style)
  • The Kumbric Witches of the south

Related Pages

  • The Witch - Primary class using this tradition
  • The Grimmerie - Legendary book of witch magic
  • Green Elixir - Potion that enhances witch power
  • Grimmerie Tradition - Academic arcane magic
  • Elphaba - The most famous witch in Oz

character/backgrounds/shiz-university-gr.title: Shiz University Student/Graduate
character/backgrounds/shiz-university-gr.content:
Shiz University Student/Graduate

"Shiz made me sharp. It did not make me brave."

Overview

Shiz University sells its students a story: learning as a ladder, scholarship as a shield. In practice, Shiz is a mirror. It reflects back who you are, who you want to be, and who you will pretend to be when the room gets quiet.

You studied among heirs, strivers, and ideologues. You watched ideas get rewarded, punished, or politely buried. You left with a name that opens doors, and a memory of how easily doors can close - especially for those who were never meant to be inside.

Applicable Races

Shiz is overwhelmingly human, though its gates have never been perfectly sealed.

  • Gillikinese: Legacy students and well-funded scholars from the north
  • Emerald City Native: Children of officials and merchants hungry for polish
  • Munchkinlander: Scholarship students, ambitious transfers, political projects
  • Animals: Rare; those admitted often paid in humiliation for access

Skill Proficiencies

History, Investigation

Tool Proficiencies

Calligrapher's supplies

Languages

One of your choice

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A worn course reader with marginal notes
  • A school ring or enamel pin
  • Fine but practical clothes
  • A journal and ink
  • A pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: Academic Network

You can usually find a sympathetic alum, a library, or a lecture hall in any major settlement. Even rivals may trade favors when the favor is discreet and the source is Shiz.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I annotate everything, even conversations.
2I keep my opinions polite until I know the room.
3I collect rumors like citations.
4I overexplain when nervous.
5I still dream in exam timetables.
6I cannot resist a good argument.
7I distrust easy answers on principle.
8I carry shame about who I ignored at Shiz.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Knowledge (Neutral). Truth matters more than comfort
2Reform (Lawful). Institutions can be bent, not burned
3Justice (Good). The clever should protect the vulnerable
4Ambition (Neutral). If I do not rise, I will be crushed
5Subversion (Chaotic). A polished smile is a useful mask
6Control (Evil). Order is the only mercy Oz offers

Bonds

d6Bond
1I owe a mentor who took a risk on me.
2A classmate knows what I did - and what I did not do.
3I guard a set of notes that someone would kill for.
4My scholarship came with strings; the knot is still tight.
5I left someone behind in the worst moment.
6Shiz made me; I will not let it erase me.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I confuse being right with being safe.
2I go cold when emotions get loud.
3I will betray a friend to protect my future.
4I cannot stop collecting leverage.
5I panic when I feel uneducated.
6I assume the system will eventually reward me.

GM Notes

Use Shiz as a pipeline: old classmates as allies or antagonists, faculty as patrons, and archived secrets as plot fuel. Shiz ties cleanly to court intrigue, resistance recruitment, or a personal reckoning with complicity.

Related Pages

  • Shiz University
  • Shiz University
  • Gillikin
  • The Scholar

character/backgrounds/crage-hall-attende.title: Crage Hall Attendee
character/backgrounds/crage-hall-attende.content:
Crage Hall Attendee

"They taught us to speak in rooms that pretended not to hear."

Overview

Crage Hall is a city within Shiz: a place where young women learn to read between lines, and to write new ones when the old lines choke.

Some come for ideals, some for strategy, some for shelter. You learned how power dresses itself up as etiquette - and how to use etiquette as a blade without drawing blood in public.

Applicable Races

Crage Hall is mostly human, shaped by class and access more than blood.

  • Gillikinese: Well-funded students with time to think and time to scheme
  • Emerald City Native: Practical social climbers and daughters of office
  • Munchkinlander: Outsiders who learned to survive by reading people
  • Outlander: Guests and transfers carrying foreign manners and secrets

Skill Proficiencies

Insight, Persuasion

Tool Proficiencies

Calligrapher's supplies

Languages

One of your choice

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A slim notebook of coded observations
  • A set of formal gloves or a modest fan
  • A ribbon or badge from Crage Hall
  • Perfume or soap of good quality
  • A pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: Sister-Circle

When you can plausibly trace a connection to Crage Hall, you can usually find a willing ear: someone who will pass a message, vouch for your character, or arrange a quiet introduction.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I notice who stands where, and why.
2I never waste a compliment.
3I ask small questions to learn big truths.
4I keep my anger tidy.
5I always have an exit plan.
6I am loyal to the people who saw me clearly.
7I weaponize gossip, then feel guilty about it.
8I trust women faster than I trust systems.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Solidarity (Good). No one survives alone
2Strategy (Neutral). Feelings are data
3Dignity (Lawful). I will not be made small
4Disruption (Chaotic). Polite rebellion still counts
5Influence (Neutral). Soft power is still power
6Revenge (Evil). I remember every slight

Bonds

d6Bond
1A fellow Crage student has my back - for now.
2I promised to protect someone less powerful than me.
3A mentor taught me the rules; I learned the loopholes.
4I carry letters that could ruin a family.
5I love someone I should not.
6I will not let my old life find me.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I default to manipulation.
2I dismiss people who cannot read a room.
3I would rather be admired than understood.
4I lie smoothly, then forget to stop.
5I hoard secrets until they rot.
6I flinch from direct confrontation.

GM Notes

Crage Hall is perfect for social leverage: rivals with shared history, alumnae networks, and a slow-burn scandal. Use it to seed contacts in the Palace, Shiz faculty, or the underground.

Related Pages

  • Shiz University
  • Shiz University
  • The Scholar
  • Gillikin

character/backgrounds/three-queens-colle.title: Three Queens College Alumnus
character/backgrounds/three-queens-colle.content:
Three Queens College Alumnus

"They polished us until we could see our own distortions."

Overview

Three Queens College is a finishing forge: education wrapped in velvet, ambition served with tea. You learned how culture can be used as currency and how kindness can be staged.

Your degree is a passport to salons and closed doors. It also comes with a price: the expectation that you will be useful, presentable, and loyal to the story your benefactors prefer.

Applicable Races

This background is strongly associated with privileged human circles.

  • Gillikinese: The core student body, groomed for influence
  • Emerald City Native: Children of wealth who want legitimacy
  • Outlander: Diplomatic daughters and carefully chosen guests
  • Munchkinlander: Rare scholarship cases, often watched closely

Skill Proficiencies

Persuasion, Deception

Tool Proficiencies

Gaming set (cards or dice)

Languages

One of your choice

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A formal invitation you never used (or never returned)
  • A signet-like accessory or tasteful jewelry
  • A fashionable outfit and a plain travel outfit
  • A small bottle of ink and a wax seal
  • A pouch containing 15 gp

Feature: Well-Placed Introductions

In cities and court-adjacent spaces, you can usually get an audience - not with the most powerful person, but with someone who matters and remembers names.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I smile when I am furious.
2I can make any room feel smaller.
3I collect favors like heirlooms.
4I speak softly to make others lean in.
5I hate being underestimated almost as much as I enjoy it.
6I treat etiquette as a second language.
7I am nostalgic for a place I resented.
8I always know the price of a gift.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Grace (Lawful). Power should look effortless
2Truth (Good). A beautiful lie still poisons
3Status (Neutral). Rank is the only protection
4Freedom (Chaotic). I refuse to be curated
5Duty (Lawful). I must represent my house well
6Dominance (Evil). The world is a ladder; I climb

Bonds

d6Bond
1A patron paid for my education; the debt remains.
2I keep a friend safe by holding her secret.
3A rival knows my weak spot and enjoys it.
4I am trying to restore a family name.
5I love the idea of someone more than the person.
6My alma mater expects my loyalty on command.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I confuse taste with virtue.
2I assume people want what I want.
3I am reckless when bored.
4I weaponize charm, then blame others.
5I fear poverty more than death.
6I cannot admit I was wrong.

GM Notes

Three Queens alumni are great for high-society play: invitations, patronage, and enemies who smile while they twist the knife. Drop a gala, a hostage negotiation, or a public scandal into the campaign.

Related Pages

  • Emerald City
  • The Palace
  • The Scholar
  • Gillikinese

character/backgrounds/briscoe-hall.title: Briscoe Hall
character/backgrounds/briscoe-hall.content:
Briscoe Hall

"They gave us skills, not illusions."

Overview

Briscoe Hall is where the work happens: practical learning, grudging respect, and a clear view of who gets thanked when a machine runs.

You learned to fix what breaks - and to recognize when a system is built to break someone else. You do not romanticize labor. You know its cost.

Applicable Races

Briscoe is a common path for working-class humans and a few outsiders who found a crack in the gate.

  • Munchkinlander: Apprentices, scholarship kids, and stubborn talent
  • Gillikinese: Second sons, black sheep, and practical minds
  • Emerald City Native: Clerks and technicians who want real skill
  • The Touched: Those who learned to survive by making themselves useful

Skill Proficiencies

Athletics, Investigation

Tool Proficiencies

Artisan's tools (choose one)

Languages

None

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A tool roll appropriate to your trade
  • A rough apron or work coat
  • A small tin of grease or polish
  • A set of chalks and a measuring cord
  • A pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: Find the Work

In any town with industry, you can usually locate the people who actually keep things running and earn at least modest pay or shelter in exchange for honest labor.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I distrust pretty speeches.
2I fix things to calm down.
3I take pride in work no one notices.
4I laugh at danger when I should not.
5I keep my hands busy in tense moments.
6I know where every exit and ladder is.
7I hold grudges with patience.
8I feel responsible for everyone else's mess.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Craft (Neutral). Skill is a form of truth
2Solidarity (Good). Workers protect workers
3Pragmatism (Neutral). Do what works, not what sells
4Freedom (Chaotic). No master owns my hands
5Order (Lawful). Rules prevent waste and harm
6Profit (Evil). If they exploit me, I exploit back

Bonds

d6Bond
1My teacher gave me a second chance; I honor it.
2I send money home whenever I can.
3I keep a tool that belonged to someone I lost.
4I am building something in secret.
5A foreman or boss wants me back.
6I owe a debt to the person who got me into Briscoe.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I think feelings are inefficient.
2I pick fights with arrogant people.
3I refuse help, even when I need it.
4I sabotage authority on instinct.
5I measure my worth in output.
6I take risks to prove I matter.

GM Notes

Briscoe backgrounds shine in investigation and infiltration: access to workshops, knowledge of locks, gears, and routines. Use labor disputes, sabotage plots, and industrial secrets as hooks.

Related Pages

  • Shiz University
  • The Artisan
  • Gillikin
  • Shiz University

character/backgrounds/courts-of-justice-.title: Courts of Justice Clerk
character/backgrounds/courts-of-justice-.content:
Courts of Justice Clerk

"In Oz, ink can hurt more than knives."

Overview

You learned the law the way most people learn weather: by watching it change and trying not to get struck. The Courts of Justice are a machine that runs on precedent, bribes, and fear of embarrassment.

As a clerk, you saw who got heard and who got erased. You know the right forms, the right doors, and the quiet tricks that turn a case from 'lost' into 'delayed.'

Applicable Races

Clerks are typically human, drawn from families that value stability and discretion.

  • Emerald City Native: City clerks with a feel for procedure and pressure
  • Gillikinese: Educated functionaries placed into service
  • Munchkinlander: Lower-office workers who learned caution early
  • Outlander: Occasional specialists hired for foreign disputes

Skill Proficiencies

Insight, Investigation

Tool Proficiencies

Calligrapher's supplies

Languages

One of your choice

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A stamped ledger with blank pages
  • A set of sealing wax and a simple signet
  • A small knife or letter opener
  • Plain clothes suitable for an office
  • A pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: Paper Authority

You can usually identify the proper office, official, or filing system for a legal or civic matter, and you can secure a brief meeting or access to non-sensitive records with the right etiquette.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I speak in careful, qualified sentences.
2I notice inconsistencies immediately.
3I keep copies of everything.
4I never volunteer information for free.
5I enjoy watching powerful people sweat.
6I hate messes - moral or physical.
7I treat gossip like evidence.
8I flinch when someone raises their voice.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Procedure (Lawful). Rules are a kind of mercy
2Fairness (Good). The powerless deserve hearings too
3Prudence (Neutral). Survive first, judge later
4Transparency (Chaotic). Secrecy breeds rot
5Loyalty (Lawful). My office protects me; I protect it
6Leverage (Evil). Every file is a weapon

Bonds

d6Bond
1I protect a client I should not.
2I owe a favor to a judge or bailiff.
3A case from my past still haunts me.
4My family depends on my salary.
5I have evidence that could topple an official.
6I keep a colleague's secret to keep my own.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I delay problems until they become disasters.
2I cannot resist blackmail when offered.
3I treat people like paperwork.
4I panic when confronted with violence.
5I trust institutions more than humans.
6I tell myself 'just following orders'.

GM Notes

Clerks are plot glue: warrants, records, missing files, legal loopholes, and the people who quietly control civic life. Use them to introduce corruption, false charges, or a dangerous archive.

Related Pages

  • Emerald City
  • The Palace
  • The Scholar
  • Emerald City Native

character/backgrounds/mauntery-escapee.title: Mauntery Escapee
character/backgrounds/mauntery-escapee.content:
Mauntery Escapee

"Silence is holy until it becomes a cage."

Overview

Maunteries promise purity: a life pared down to prayer, labor, and obedience. You entered for shelter, conviction, punishment, or lack of choices.

You left anyway. Maybe you ran. Maybe you were pushed out. Either way, you carry the discipline of that life and the bruises of what the world does to women who refuse to stay put.

Applicable Races

Maunteries are Unionist institutions and are almost always human.

  • Munchkinlander: Families sending daughters to be 'safe' and useful
  • Gillikinese: Well-bred women hiding scandal or grief
  • Quadling: Rural girls taken in after war or famine
  • Emerald City Native: Orphans and unwanted children of the city

Skill Proficiencies

Insight, Medicine

Tool Proficiencies

Herbalism kit

Languages

One of your choice

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A plain habit or shawl you no longer wear (but kept)
  • A prayer token to the Unnamed God
  • A small kit of bandages and dried herbs
  • A hand-copied page from a forbidden book
  • A pouch containing 8 gp

Feature: Sanctuary by Habit

You know how maunteries work: their schedules, their gatekeeping, and their quiet economies. You can usually secure a night of shelter or a private conversation with a sister - even if you are not welcome to stay.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I wake before dawn out of habit.
2I find comfort in routine.
3I speak softly, then surprise people.
4I cannot stand wasted food.
5I notice injuries and sickness first.
6I keep my hands busy when afraid.
7I pray when I am angry.
8I distrust pleasure on principle - then crave it.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Mercy (Good). Care is a kind of rebellion
2Obedience (Lawful). Submission keeps the world stable
3Freedom (Chaotic). No vow should be forced
4Truth (Neutral). Faith without honesty is rot
5Atonement (Lawful). I must pay for what I did
6Resentment (Evil). I will make them regret the cage

Bonds

d6Bond
1A sister helped me escape; I owe her.
2I left someone behind who could not run.
3I carry a secret from inside the walls.
4My family thinks I am dead.
5A Unionist official wants me returned.
6I still love the faith I fled.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I judge others harshly for small indulgences.
2I freeze when commanded.
3I cannot accept kindness without suspicion.
4I avoid intimacy like a sin.
5I cling to suffering as proof.
6I lash out when I feel trapped.

GM Notes

A mauntery escapee invites pursuit, shelter scenes, and spiritual conflict. Use sisterly allies, Unionist pressure, and the temptation to return for answers or protection.

Related Pages

  • Mauntery System
  • Unionist Church
  • The Unnamed God
  • The Unionist

character/backgrounds/mauntery-devotee.title: Mauntery Devotee
character/backgrounds/mauntery-devotee.content:
Mauntery Devotee

"I gave up my name so the world could not take it."

Overview

You chose the mauntery. You chose the rules, the labor, the long silences. In return, the world stopped demanding you perform.

Devotion does not mean naivete. You know what the maunteries hide, what they heal, and what they trade with the Palace to remain untouched.

Applicable Races

This background assumes a Unionist human upbringing, though devotion can take many shapes.

  • Munchkinlander: Commoners who found purpose and protection in vows
  • Gillikinese: Women who rejected marriage as a destiny
  • Emerald City Native: Those pulled into service through orphanages and charities
  • Quadling: Refugees who clung to faith after devastation

Skill Proficiencies

Medicine, Religion (or Insight)

Tool Proficiencies

Herbalism kit

Languages

One of your choice

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A simple habit or work dress
  • A bundle of herbs and salves
  • A devotional text with your annotations
  • A small bell or chime for prayers
  • A pouch containing 6 gp

Feature: House of Quiet Doors

Sisters recognize you as one of theirs. You can usually gain access to a mauntery, receive basic care, and request a discreet favor, provided you do not endanger the house.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I listen longer than is comfortable.
2I speak in parables when directness feels sharp.
3I keep calm in emergencies.
4I measure my days by tasks, not moods.
5I offer help before it is asked.
6I dislike waste and excess.
7I see omens everywhere.
8I can be frighteningly stubborn.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Service (Good). To heal is to resist
2Discipline (Lawful). Freedom requires structure
3Humility (Neutral). Pride is a trap
4Compassion (Good). Even monsters bleed
5Secrecy (Lawful). Some truths should stay inside walls
6Purity (Evil). The world must be cleansed

Bonds

d6Bond
1My mauntery is my family now.
2A patient changed me; I will not forget.
3I protect a relic or record the Palace wants.
4I correspond with someone in the outside world.
5A sister is in danger because of me.
6I made a vow I cannot break.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I confuse obedience with goodness.
2I underestimate secular cruelty.
3I hide anger behind prayer.
4I am slow to forgive myself.
5I avoid choices by calling them 'fate'.
6I can be judgmental when afraid.

GM Notes

A devotee pulls the game toward healing, confession, and moral dilemmas. Use safehouses, hidden archives, and the tension between faith and politics.

Related Pages

  • Mauntery System
  • Unionist Church
  • The Unnamed God
  • The Unionist

character/backgrounds/pleasure-faith-apo.title: Pleasure Faith Apostate
character/backgrounds/pleasure-faith-apo.content:
Pleasure Faith Apostate

"The old gods do not punish. People do."

Overview

You were raised on the old ways: Lurline's stories, seasonal rites, small pleasures treated as sacred. Then came pressure, shame, or survival, and you stepped away.

Leaving did not erase what you learned. You still recognize a shrine hidden under a kitchen table. You still know which songs make a room feel like summer.

Applicable Races

The old ways persist in pockets across Oz, especially where the Unionist gaze is weaker.

  • Quadling: Communities where older rites survived catastrophe
  • Outlander: Foreigners with parallel folk traditions
  • Munchkinlander: Rural families holding to inherited customs
  • Animals: Rare; some Animal communities keep their own old rites

Skill Proficiencies

Performance, Survival

Tool Proficiencies

Musical instrument (choose one)

Languages

One of your choice

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A small charm tied with colored thread
  • A set of candles or powdered incense
  • A simple instrument or songbook
  • A travel cloak with hidden pockets
  • A pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: Old Signs

You can usually identify a sympathetic household, folk healer, or hidden shrine tied to Lurline and the old ways. When you ask for help respectfully, people may offer quiet aid - or quiet warnings.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I talk to storms like they can hear me.
2I cook by smell, not recipe.
3I keep my joy private.
4I trust rituals more than sermons.
5I collect stories from elders.
6I resent anyone who calls my past 'sin'.
7I sing when afraid.
8I feel guilty for leaving - and relieved.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Wonder (Good). Small joys keep us human
2Tradition (Lawful). Old ways hold old wisdom
3Choice (Chaotic). Faith must be voluntary
4Survival (Neutral). Belief is a luxury sometimes
5Reclamation (Neutral). I will take back what was stolen
6Scorn (Evil). I despise all piety

Bonds

d6Bond
1I protect a secret shrine location.
2A Unionist enforcer ruined my family.
3A mentor taught me rites I half-remember.
4I carry a promise made at a festival.
5I am searching for someone who vanished after conversion.
6My old community still watches me.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I romanticize the past.
2I bristle at any authority.
3I risk myself for symbolic gestures.
4I hide behind superstition.
5I cannot let insults go.
6I distrust help that comes with rules.

GM Notes

Great for folk magic, hidden networks, and religious tension. Use secret festivals, Unionist crackdowns, and moral choices about faith versus safety.

Related Pages

  • Lurline Old Ways
  • The Lurlinite
  • Quadling Country
  • Unionist Church

character/backgrounds/wizards-bureaucrat.title: Wizard's Bureaucrat
character/backgrounds/wizards-bureaucrat.content:
Wizard's Bureaucrat

"I stamped the paper. I told myself that was not the same as harm."

Overview

You served the Wizard's administration, where cruelty wore a clean collar. Your work might have been mundane: permits, censuses, travel passes, requisitions.

Then you learned what those documents enabled. Maybe you stayed. Maybe you fled. Either way, you understand the old machine - its habits, its weak points, and how quickly it can be restarted by anyone hungry for power.

Applicable Races

Government service under the Wizard was dominated by humans and built on loyalty tests.

  • Emerald City Native: City clerks and upward strivers
  • Gillikinese: Educated administrators placed in office
  • Munchkinlander: Conscripts and low-level workers
  • Outlander: Specialists recruited for their outside knowledge

Skill Proficiencies

History, Deception

Tool Proficiencies

Calligrapher's supplies

Languages

One of your choice

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • An old badge or stamped travel pass
  • A ledger of coded accounts
  • A bottle of ink and quills
  • Plain official clothes
  • A pouch containing 12 gp

Feature: Old Channels

You know how to route requests, bribes, and messages through the remnants of Wizard-era bureaucracy. You can usually identify who still benefits from the old system - and who fears being exposed.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I keep my face neutral by reflex.
2I prefer written promises to spoken ones.
3I notice uniforms and insignia first.
4I speak like a memo even when I should not.
5I remember names, debts, and dates.
6I can justify almost anything - then hate myself.
7I distrust idealists.
8I cannot stop scanning for surveillance.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Accountability (Good). Someone must answer for what happened
2Stability (Lawful). Order prevents bloodshed
3Pragmatism (Neutral). Live long enough to matter
4Reform (Neutral). Fix the machine from inside
5Freedom (Chaotic). Burn the files, free the people
6Control (Evil). Fear is efficient

Bonds

d6Bond
1I keep a file that could save or ruin someone.
2An old colleague wants me silent.
3I owe an Animal a debt I cannot repay.
4My family still believes the Wizard was right.
5I protected one person by harming another.
6I am haunted by a name on a list.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I minimize my own responsibility.
2I lie automatically to stay safe.
3I assume everyone is corrupt.
4I freeze when asked to take a side.
5I hoard evidence instead of acting.
6I panic when my past is mentioned.

GM Notes

Use this background to expose historical secrets, spark redemption arcs, or set up blackmail plots. Old memos lead to new crimes; old allies become dangerous liabilities.

Related Pages

  • The Wizard Reign
  • The Palace
  • Emerald City
  • The Agent

character/backgrounds/emperors-administr.title: Emperor's Administrator
character/backgrounds/emperors-administr.content:
Emperor's Administrator

"The regime changed its banner. The paperwork did not."

Overview

You serve Emperor Shell's government - or served it until the work became unbearable. The imperial court is less theatrical than the Wizard's, but no less hungry.

You have learned the art of survival in a shifting capital: who to flatter, who to fear, and how to do the least harm while keeping your job - or how to do great harm while calling it 'policy.'

Applicable Races

Imperial administrators are almost always human and tied to the Emerald City.

  • Emerald City Native: Career officials with local connections
  • Gillikinese: Educated outsiders placed into service
  • Munchkinlander: Representatives and reluctant liaisons
  • Outlander: Specialists handling foreign correspondence

Skill Proficiencies

Insight, Persuasion

Tool Proficiencies

Calligrapher's supplies

Languages

One of your choice

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A sealed letter of appointment (expired or current)
  • A small set of wax and stamps
  • A ledger of schedules and favors
  • A plain cloak that looks expensive up close
  • A pouch containing 12 gp

Feature: Imperial Access

You can usually secure a meeting with a mid-level official, gain entry to a government building, or learn which department controls a given decision - provided you behave like you belong.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I speak politely while calculating risk.
2I know who outranks whom in any room.
3I keep my hands clean, or try to.
4I never waste a favor.
5I dread being replaced by someone crueler.
6I am fascinated by power like a fire.
7I compartmentalize everything.
8I cannot sleep without counting consequences.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Continuity (Lawful). A state must function
2Compassion (Good). Policy should reduce suffering
3Ambition (Neutral). I deserve to rise
4Dissent (Chaotic). A government must be challenged
5Loyalty (Lawful). Shell saved Oz from chaos
6Dominion (Evil). People exist to be managed

Bonds

d6Bond
1I protect an official I respect.
2I owe a debt to the Palace.
3A file of mine disappeared; I need it back.
4My work funds my family's safety.
5I secretly aid the resistance.
6I am being watched by someone in uniform.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I delay hard decisions until others suffer.
2I rationalize cruelty as 'necessary'.
3I fear scandal more than injustice.
4I treat people like assets.
5I believe I can outsmart the regime.
6I panic when the chain of command breaks.

GM Notes

Perfect for court intrigue and moral grayness. Use budget cuts, secret decrees, and purges. Administrators can be patrons, informants, or the person holding the lever everyone wants.

Related Pages

  • Emperor Shell Reign
  • The Palace
  • Emerald City
  • Home Guard

character/backgrounds/gale-force-veteran.title: Gale Force Veteran
character/backgrounds/gale-force-veteran.content:
Gale Force Veteran

"When you wear a uniform long enough, it starts wearing you."

Overview

The Gale Force trained you to see threats everywhere and to become one when ordered. You learned surveillance, intimidation, and the quiet violence that leaves no witnesses.

Now you are out - by choice, by injury, by betrayal, or by purge. The world remembers your badge even if you try to forget it.

Applicable Races

The Gale Force was a human institution; Animals were targets, not recruits.

  • Emerald City Native: City recruits and ambitious enforcers
  • Gillikinese: Officers with education and patronage
  • Munchkinlander: Conscripts and desperate careerists
  • The Touched: Useful 'monsters' kept on a short leash

Skill Proficiencies

Intimidation, Perception

Tool Proficiencies

Disguise kit

Languages

None

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A battered insignia (hidden or defaced)
  • A dark cloak and sturdy boots
  • A set of manacles or rope
  • A small vial of oil for weapons and locks
  • A pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: Residual Fear

Common folk recognize the posture of an enforcer. In tense situations, many will hesitate to cross you or will offer information quickly - though others may react with hatred or panic.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I scan crowds for exits and angles.
2I dislike surprises.
3I speak in short, controlled phrases.
4I feel safest with my back to a wall.
5I test people to see if they break.
6I regret, but I do not confess easily.
7I keep trophies I should not.
8I am gentler with the powerless than with peers.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Order (Lawful). Chaos kills
2Redemption (Good). I will undo some harm
3Survival (Neutral). I will not be used again
4Truth (Chaotic). Expose what the uniform hid
5Loyalty (Lawful). The Force was my family
6Predation (Evil). Fear is the only language

Bonds

d6Bond
1A former partner knows my secrets.
2I owe someone I interrogated an apology.
3I am hunted by my old commander.
4I protect a witness I once threatened.
5My badge still opens one dangerous door.
6I cannot abandon someone in a cell.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I default to violence.
2I cannot tolerate disobedience.
3I numb my guilt with cruelty or drink.
4I assume everyone is lying.
5I provoke fights to feel control.
6I cannot ask for help.

GM Notes

Use Gale Force ties to generate pursuers, grudging respect, or revenge. A veteran may know Southstairs routes, old informants, and which officials still miss the Wizard.

Related Pages

  • Gale Force
  • The Wizard Reign
  • Southstairs
  • Southstairs Guide

character/backgrounds/resistance-courier.title: Resistance Courier
character/backgrounds/resistance-courier.content:
Resistance Courier

"A message is a small thing until it gets someone killed."

Overview

You carried words, medicine, maps, or names for people who could not travel openly. You learned to run light, lie fast, and trust slowly.

Couriers live between worlds: the public life that must look ordinary, and the hidden life that asks for courage with no applause.

Applicable Races

Couriers come from anywhere the resistance can recruit, human or Animal.

  • Munchkinlander: Rural routes and family networks
  • Emerald City Native: Urban couriers who know alleys and schedules
  • Outlander: Travelers whose accents draw the wrong assumptions
  • Animals: Those who move without being suspected - until they are

Skill Proficiencies

Stealth, Survival

Tool Proficiencies

Disguise kit

Languages

One of your choice

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A scarf or belt with hidden stitching
  • A set of coded notes (blank until warmed or wet)
  • A small satchel of mundane supplies
  • A map with marks only you understand
  • A pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: Dead Drops

You know the logic of clandestine networks: drop sites, countersigns, and how to spot a tail. You can usually find a way to pass a message without a meeting.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I memorize routes by smell and sound.
2I do not say names out loud.
3I trust animals and children first.
4I keep my emotions tight.
5I make friends quickly, then disappear.
6I sleep lightly.
7I hate locked doors.
8I carry guilt like extra weight.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Freedom (Good). No one should live in fear
2Secrecy (Lawful). Loose words kill
3Hope (Good). Small acts add up
4Pragmatism (Neutral). Win first, mourn later
5Defiance (Chaotic). I refuse to be managed
6Vengeance (Evil). I deliver pain along with letters

Bonds

d6Bond
1Someone depends on my deliveries to survive.
2I carry a message meant for the dead.
3I owe a safehouse owner my life.
4My handler vanished; I need answers.
5I promised an Animal family I would help.
6I keep a token from the first person I saved.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I bolt when I feel trapped.
2I lie even when honesty is safe.
3I cannot relax in public.
4I take reckless risks to prove courage.
5I judge anyone who stays neutral.
6I hoard secrets until they isolate me.

GM Notes

Couriers are instant hooks: intercepted messages, compromised routes, and handlers in trouble. Build episodes around chases, coded letters, and choosing who gets saved first.

Related Pages

  • Animal Resistance
  • Animal Underground Railroad
  • Munchkinland
  • The Traveler

character/backgrounds/conference-of-the-.title: Conference of the Birds Veteran
character/backgrounds/conference-of-the-.content:
Conference of the Birds Veteran

"We met in branches and shadows. Then the shadows learned our names."

Overview

The Conference of the Birds was hope with feathers: a coalition of sentient Birds and allies resisting the Silencing of Animals. You were there when songs became strategy.

You survived the collapse. Maybe you escaped a raid. Maybe you were left behind and clawed your way out. Either way, you have the memory of unity - and the fear that unity invites slaughter.

Applicable Races

This background is best suited to sentient Birds, though a rare ally might have been present.

  • Animals (Birds): The core of the Conference
  • Animals (Mammals): Occasional allied messengers and scouts
  • Winged Monkeys: Rare, complicated allies or coerced participants
  • Outlander: Very rare sympathizers from outside Oz

Skill Proficiencies

Perception, Survival

Tool Proficiencies

None

Languages

One of your choice (if you can speak)

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A feather token or carved perch-mark
  • A strip of cloth with coded knots
  • A small bundle of food tied for travel
  • A trinket from a fallen comrade
  • A pouch containing 5 gp (or barter goods)

Feature: Sky Routes

You know hidden paths: rooftops, treelines, and safe roosts. You can usually find a discreet place to rest or observe without being noticed - and you recognize the signs of Animal resistance cells.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I watch from above before I speak.
2I distrust cages of any kind.
3I mourn loudly, then move on.
4I tell stories to keep the dead present.
5I keep my back to open sky.
6I snap when I hear slurs about Animals.
7I am suspicious of every peace offer.
8I laugh at humans' confidence.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Kinship (Good). Animals must protect Animals
2Secrecy (Lawful). Survival requires silence
3Defiance (Chaotic). Better to fall flying
4Memory (Neutral). We owe the dead truth
5Balance (Neutral). Oz is shared land
6Retribution (Evil). I will make them afraid

Bonds

d6Bond
1I carry a message that never arrived.
2A flockmate is missing; I still search.
3I protect a hidden roost location.
4I owe my life to a human sympathizer.
5I refuse to abandon imprisoned Animals.
6The Conference is my home, even in ruins.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I flee when cornered, even from allies.
2I assume betrayal is inevitable.
3I refuse help from humans out of pride.
4I pick fights I cannot win.
5I cannot stop reliving the raid.
6I treat caution as cruelty.

GM Notes

Use this background to tie players to Animal politics, hunted networks, and deep grief. Bird veterans bring reconnaissance advantages and emotionally charged conflicts with the Palace.

Related Pages

  • Birds
  • Animal Resistance
  • The Wizard Reign
  • Animal Underground Railroad

character/backgrounds/underground-railro.title: Underground Railroad Operator
character/backgrounds/underground-railro.content:
Underground Railroad Operator

"I did not save the world. I saved whoever knocked."

Overview

You ran safe houses, false trails, and quiet bargains to move sentient Animals out of reach. Some nights you were a hero. Other nights you were a liar with a locked pantry.

You learned that rescue is logistics: food, blankets, papers, and nerves. You also learned the cost of being found.

Applicable Races

Operators include both humans and Animals, depending on the route and era.

  • Munchkinlander: Farmers and villagers with hidden rooms
  • Emerald City Native: City operators moving people through crowds
  • Animals: Those sheltering kin while pretending to be ordinary
  • Outlander: Border contacts and smugglers

Skill Proficiencies

Stealth, Insight

Tool Proficiencies

Disguise kit

Languages

One of your choice

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A set of false travel papers
  • A small lantern with a shuttered hood
  • A coded list of safehouse signs
  • A warm blanket folded tight
  • A pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: Safehouse Web

You can usually find a sympathetic household, cellar, or back room that will shelter someone for a night, provided you can credibly signal you are part of the old network.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I cannot ignore a knock after dark.
2I keep spare food even when broke.
3I lie calmly under pressure.
4I study people for signs of fear.
5I speak in code without thinking.
6I keep my windows covered.
7I am gentle until threatened.
8I do not forgive betrayals.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Protection (Good). No one deserves the leash
2Caution (Lawful). A living refugee is the goal
3Solidarity (Good). We share risk
4Defiance (Chaotic). Aid is a weapon
5Pragmatism (Neutral). Some people cannot be saved
6Control (Evil). I decide who gets help

Bonds

d6Bond
1An Animal family lives because of me.
2I lost someone on my route; I still hear it.
3A safehouse owner is in prison now.
4My home bears a hidden mark only the network knows.
5I keep a list of names I must deliver.
6I swore an oath over a grave.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I take unnecessary risks for strangers.
2I suspect everyone of spying.
3I refuse to ask for help.
4I am cold to people who are not 'the cause'.
5I hoard supplies until others go without.
6I cannot stop planning for disaster.

GM Notes

This background naturally generates rescue missions, betrayals, and tense shelter scenes. Use compromised routes, bribed officials, and moral choices about who to move first.

Related Pages

  • Animal Underground Railroad
  • Animal Resistance
  • Criminal Networks
  • Emerald City

character/backgrounds/free-munchkinland-.title: Free Munchkinland Revolutionary
character/backgrounds/free-munchkinland-.content:
Free Munchkinland Revolutionary

"Freedom is expensive. We paid anyway."

Overview

Munchkinland's secession was not a speech. It was hunger, raids, conscription, and the slow realization that the capital would rather punish than negotiate.

You fought for independence - as a soldier, saboteur, medic, or propagandist. You also saw what revolution does to ordinary neighbors when everyone must pick a side.

Applicable Races

This background is most common among Munchkinlanders, with a few allied outsiders.

  • Munchkinlander: The core of the movement and its armies
  • Emerald City Native: Defectors, spies, or children of mixed loyalties
  • Outlander: Mercenaries and idealists
  • Animals: Rare allies harmed by the same regimes

Skill Proficiencies

Athletics, Intimidation

Tool Proficiencies

Gaming set (cards)

Languages

None

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A patched revolutionary armband or scarf
  • A crude map of supply routes
  • A letter from home you cannot answer
  • A small knife or whetstone
  • A pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: Rebel Contacts

Among sympathetic Munchkinlanders, you can usually find a contact for food, shelter, or information. Even in hostile territory, someone may quietly point you toward help - or away from danger.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I treat neutrality as a warning sign.
2I keep trophies I hate.
3I laugh too loudly after danger.
4I trust comrades faster than civilians.
5I plan for betrayal, always.
6I cannot stand uniforms.
7I talk like a pamphlet when tired.
8I miss the person I was before the war.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Liberty (Chaotic). No empire owns my home
2Justice (Good). We fight because we were harmed
3Discipline (Lawful). A cause needs structure
4Survival (Neutral). Win, then decide what it means
5Unity (Lawful). Munchkinland must not fracture
6Hatred (Evil). I want them to suffer

Bonds

d6Bond
1My unit is my family.
2I promised to bring someone back alive.
3I protect a hidden cache of supplies.
4A loyalist burned my home.
5I carry proof of a war crime.
6I am still in love with an enemy.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I escalate conflicts quickly.
2I cannot stop looking for fights.
3I struggle to live without a cause.
4I treat civilians like obstacles.
5I cannot forgive compromise.
6I would sacrifice anyone for victory.

GM Notes

Use this background for war stories, partisan politics, and moral fallout. It also connects easily to Home Guard opposition, imperial crackdowns, and post-war reconciliation arcs.

Related Pages

  • Free Munchkinland
  • Munchkinland
  • Home Guard
  • Emperor Shell Reign

character/backgrounds/southstairs-surviv.title: Southstairs Survivor
character/backgrounds/southstairs-surviv.content:
Southstairs Survivor

"The stairs go down forever. I learned to climb anyway."

Overview

Southstairs is a rumor until it is your cell. You were taken, questioned, broken - or nearly. You learned how the state makes people disappear.

You escaped, were released, or were forgotten. The outside world looks unreal now. You carry scars people cannot see, and you recognize the machinery of cruelty by sound.

Applicable Races

Southstairs held dissidents of many kinds, human and Animal alike.

  • Emerald City Native: Political prisoners and unlucky bystanders
  • Animals: Targets of the purge and its experiments
  • Munchkinlander: Rebels and suspected smugglers
  • The Touched: Convenient scapegoats

Skill Proficiencies

Stealth, Insight

Tool Proficiencies

Thieves' tools (or None)

Languages

None

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A scrap of chain or a broken manacle
  • A small mirror you should not have
  • A rough blanket folded into a roll
  • A hidden note with one name on it
  • A pouch containing 5 gp

Feature: Hard to Break

You know how interrogators think: pressure, isolation, incentives. In tense questioning, you can often spot the moment someone is trying to force a confession - and you are harder to intimidate than most.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I startle at footsteps.
2I count exits compulsively.
3I distrust locked rooms.
4I talk too much when anxious, then shut down.
5I keep my back to walls.
6I notice bruises and fear in others.
7I can be startlingly calm in crisis.
8I laugh at jokes no one else hears.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Survival (Neutral). Staying alive is victory
2Truth (Good). No more forced confessions
3Vengeance (Evil). They will pay
4Solidarity (Good). No one goes back alone
5Secrecy (Lawful). Silence keeps people safe
6Freedom (Chaotic). Cages must end

Bonds

d6Bond
1I will find the person who betrayed me.
2Someone shared my cell; I owe them.
3I protect a list of prisoners' names.
4A guard showed mercy; I cannot forget.
5I promised to speak for the dead.
6I fear returning more than death.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I overreact to authority.
2I sabotage relationships by withholding.
3I self-medicate with risk.
4I cannot tolerate confinement.
5I see threats where there are none.
6I pick fights to feel control.

GM Notes

Southstairs survivors bring instant stakes: pursuers, missing prisoners, and evidence of torture. Use Scraped effects, memory gaps, and hard choices about exposing the truth.

Related Pages

  • Southstairs
  • Southstairs Guide
  • Scraped
  • Gale Force

character/backgrounds/apple-press-farm-s.title: Apple Press Farm Survivor
character/backgrounds/apple-press-farm-s.content:
Apple Press Farm Survivor

"They worked us until even hunger got tired."

Overview

Apple Press Farm is a prison camp hidden behind ordinary fences and ordinary lies. You were sent there for politics, suspicion, or convenience.

You learned how bodies endure. You also learned how systems keep cruelty invisible: a ledger line, a missing name, a wagon that returns empty.

Applicable Races

Camps swallowed anyone inconvenient to the regime; humans were most common, but Animals could vanish too.

  • Munchkinlander: The farm sits in their soil, eating their people
  • Quadling: Refugees and dissidents with no protection
  • Animals: Targets of the purge who survived it
  • The Touched: Easy to label and discard

Skill Proficiencies

Athletics, Survival

Tool Proficiencies

None

Languages

None

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A tin cup or battered spoon
  • A strip of cloth with a number burned in
  • A small bundle of stolen dried fruit
  • A rough work glove
  • A pouch containing 5 gp

Feature: Camp Eyes

You can judge supply lines, guard routines, and weak points in a labor system quickly. When you see forced work, you recognize what will break first - and how to exploit that without getting caught.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I hoard food instinctively.
2I sleep anywhere, anytime.
3I hate waste with fury.
4I keep my emotions hidden.
5I can endure pain longer than is healthy.
6I flinch at whistles and bells.
7I distrust kindness from officials.
8I feel safest when working.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Dignity (Good). No one is livestock
2Escape (Chaotic). Freedom is the only goal
3Endurance (Neutral). Survive; remember
4Witness (Good). Tell the truth even if it burns
5Discipline (Lawful). Rules kept me alive
6Cruelty (Evil). Pain is the only teacher

Bonds

d6Bond
1I owe my life to a fellow prisoner.
2I carry the name of someone who died there.
3A guard recognized me; I must disappear.
4I swore to destroy the farm's ledger.
5I still dream of the orchard fences.
6I seek the person who ordered my arrest.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I cannot stop hoarding.
2I explode at small humiliations.
3I sabotage plans with panic.
4I refuse rest even when safe.
5I distrust every authority figure.
6I take reckless revenge.

GM Notes

Use Apple Press Farm to introduce missing persons, secret records, and quiet conspiracies. Survivors can guide prison breaks, expose profiteers, or become targets when the past resurfaces.

Related Pages

  • Apple Press Farm
  • Munchkinland
  • The Wizard Reign
  • The Palace

character/backgrounds/quadling-genocide-.title: Quadling Genocide Survivor
character/backgrounds/quadling-genocide-.content:
Quadling Genocide Survivor

"They drained the marsh and called it progress."

Overview

You lived through the Wizard's devastation of Quadling Country: drained marshes, poisoned land, and the slow violence of displacement. You watched a world collapse into mud.

Survival taught you what the north refuses to learn: empire is hunger. You carry grief, anger, and a knowledge of the south that outsiders treat like superstition.

Applicable Races

This background is most strongly tied to Quadling communities, though survivors can become refugees anywhere.

  • Quadling: Those whose families were directly targeted
  • Outlander: Foreigners caught in the catastrophe
  • Munchkinlander: Refugees who fled north and were resented
  • Animals: Marsh creatures uprooted by the draining

Skill Proficiencies

Survival, Medicine

Tool Proficiencies

Herbalism kit

Languages

One of your choice

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A handful of red marsh clay wrapped in cloth
  • A simple charm from the old ways
  • A small kit of herbs and bandages
  • A waterskin and a worn cloak
  • A pouch containing 8 gp

Feature: Marsh Memory

You can navigate wetlands and ruined terrain that others find impossible, and you recognize signs of poisoned water, unstable ground, and old settlement patterns - useful for finding what was hidden or buried.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I do not waste water.
2I speak of the dead as present.
3I distrust promises from the north.
4I watch the ground before I watch faces.
5I carry anger like a stone.
6I can be unexpectedly tender.
7I hate mining and 'improvement' talk.
8I keep quiet until I explode.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Remembrance (Good). We keep what they tried to erase
2Retribution (Evil). The guilty must pay
3Survival (Neutral). Endure, adapt, persist
4Community (Good). No one heals alone
5Defiance (Chaotic). Refuse their stories
6Order (Lawful). Only strict rules prevent collapse

Bonds

d6Bond
1My home is gone; I carry its map in my head.
2I protect a younger survivor like kin.
3I seek a lost family member.
4I keep a relic from the marsh.
5I owe shelter to those who sheltered me.
6I will make the world witness.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I cannot forgive outsiders.
2I take risks to punish authority.
3I drown in grief without warning.
4I refuse help out of pride.
5I romanticize suffering as purity.
6I lash out when someone minimizes the genocide.

GM Notes

Use Quadling survivors to bring the campaign south: poisoned terrain, buried evidence, and vengeance plots. This background also creates tension with imperial officials and opportunistic miners.

Related Pages

  • Quadling Country
  • The Wizard Reign
  • Lurline Old Ways
  • Quadling

character/backgrounds/orphan-animal-purg.title: Orphan of the Animal Purges
character/backgrounds/orphan-animal-purg.content:
Orphan of the Animal Purges

"They took my family and left me the shape of their absence."

Overview

Your family disappeared during the purge of sentient Animals - whether you were an Animal child, a human child raised by Animals, or simply someone whose home was in the wrong place.

You grew up fast, learning which words get you hit and which words get you fed. You are fluent in loss, and you are tired of being asked to be grateful for surviving.

Applicable Races

This background can fit human or Animal characters touched by the purge.

  • Animals: Children of families targeted by Silencing and raids
  • Emerald City Native: Street survivors of crackdowns
  • Munchkinlander: Rural kids caught between loyalties
  • The Touched: Easy scapegoats when fear spreads

Skill Proficiencies

Stealth, Insight

Tool Proficiencies

Disguise kit

Languages

One of your choice

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A keepsake from your lost family
  • A small knife or sharp tool
  • A threadbare cloak with many patches
  • A pouch with hidden lining
  • A pouch containing 8 gp

Feature: Survivor's Instincts

You can usually find food, shelter, or a place to hide in an urban or oppressed community, and you recognize the unspoken rules of living under watch.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I eat fast and quietly.
2I do not trust adults.
3I remember kindness forever.
4I keep my back to crowds.
5I can read anger in a voice.
6I steal small things without thinking.
7I collect found family.
8I flinch when someone mentions 'purity'.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Protection (Good). No child should be hunted
2Independence (Neutral). Relying on others is dangerous
3Truth (Good). Names must be spoken
4Defiance (Chaotic). I will not be erased
5Pragmatism (Neutral). Morals do not feed you
6Vengeance (Evil). I want them afraid

Bonds

d6Bond
1I protect a younger orphan.
2I keep a list of the disappeared.
3Someone saved me once; I seek them.
4I owe a gang or network for shelter.
5I carry a story only I know.
6I will rebuild my family in my own way.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I steal even when I do not need to.
2I expect betrayal.
3I cannot accept authority.
4I use people before they use me.
5I shut down when grief hits.
6I punish kindness by testing it.

GM Notes

This background is a strong emotional hook: missing persons, rescue missions, and revenge arcs. It also fits campaigns focused on Animal rights and the aftershocks of the Wizard's reign.

Related Pages

  • Animal Resistance
  • The Wizard Reign
  • Emerald City
  • Mammals

character/backgrounds/former-animal-stri.title: Former Animal (Stripped of Speech)
character/backgrounds/former-animal-stri.content:
Former Animal (Stripped of Speech)

"They did not take my mind. They took my voice."

Overview

You were a speaking Animal - a person in fur or feathers - until the regime Silenced you. The process did not just steal language; it tried to steal identity.

Some Silenced Animals become animals. Others remain people trapped behind a muzzle the world cannot see. You live in gestures, looks, and the stubborn refusal to vanish.

Applicable Races

This background is for sentient Animals who have been Silenced. It is rare, and it is brutal.

  • Animals (Mammals): Silenced through raids, prisons, or 'treatments'
  • Animals (Birds): Targets after the Conference of the Birds
  • Winged Monkeys: Some were punished or modified by handlers
  • The Touched: In rare cases, the Silencing bled into other bodies

Skill Proficiencies

Perception, Survival

Tool Proficiencies

None

Languages

Understands one language you knew before; cannot speak it aloud

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A collar, tag, or token you ripped off
  • A small carved symbol for 'help' and 'danger'
  • A blanket or nest material you keep close
  • A pouch containing 5 gp (or barter goods)
  • A hidden note with your true name

Feature: Silent Signals

You can communicate meaningfully with Animals and close allies through gesture, scent marks, and learned signs. Those sympathetic to Animals often recognize your humanity - and those hostile sometimes underestimate you.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I watch mouths to understand tone.
2I hate cages viscerally.
3I bite back anger until it turns cold.
4I remember every insult.
5I am protective of other Animals.
6I avoid crowds that might treat me as property.
7I hoard small comforts.
8I react badly to being touched without consent.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Identity (Good). I am still a person
2Survival (Neutral). Endure; adapt; persist
3Liberation (Chaotic). Free the Silenced
4Witness (Good). Make them see what they did
5Secrecy (Lawful). Hide until the right moment
6Retribution (Evil). I will make them choke on fear

Bonds

d6Bond
1Someone remembers my old name.
2I protect a hidden Animal community.
3I am searching for the one who Silenced me.
4I keep a relic from my former life.
5I cannot abandon another Silenced Animal.
6I owe a human sympathizer my survival.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I lash out when misunderstood.
2I refuse help out of pride.
3I take reckless risks to prove personhood.
4I cannot tolerate confinement.
5I distrust humans by default.
6I fixate on revenge.

GM Notes

This background is intense and should be handled with care. Use it to explore identity, oppression, and difficult choices. It naturally connects to Animal Resistance and clandestine rescue operations.

Related Pages

  • The Wizard Reign
  • Animal Resistance
  • Mammals
  • Scraped

character/backgrounds/quadling-marsh-dwe.title: Quadling Marsh Dweller
character/backgrounds/quadling-marsh-dwe.content:
Quadling Marsh Dweller

"In the marsh, everything sinks eventually - even lies."

Overview

You grew up where the ground is uncertain and the air tastes like history. Marsh life teaches patience: wait for the water, read the reeds, listen for what moves beneath.

Outsiders call the marsh backward. You know it is resilient. You have seen empires come south and get swallowed.

Applicable Races

Most marsh dwellers are Quadling, though refugees and strange neighbors exist.

  • Quadling: Communities adapted to wetland life
  • Outlander: Occasional drifters who stayed
  • Animals: Marsh kin with long memory
  • Munchkinlander: Refugees who learned to live quietly

Skill Proficiencies

Nature, Survival

Tool Proficiencies

Herbalism kit

Languages

None

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A reed-woven basket
  • A mud-resistant cloak
  • A small fishing spear or net
  • A bundle of dried herbs
  • A pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: Marshcraft

You can find safe footing, edible plants, and concealed paths in wetlands and similar terrain. You also know how to hide signs of travel where the ground remembers every step.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I move slowly until I move fast.
2I distrust straight roads.
3I speak to strangers last.
4I can sit in silence for hours.
5I prefer storms to heat.
6I know which water is lying.
7I collect useful junk without shame.
8I treat promises like debts.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Resilience (Neutral). Endure what others cannot
2Hospitality (Good). Feed the lost, if they are honest
3Suspicion (Lawful). Outsiders bring trouble
4Freedom (Chaotic). No one owns marshland
5Tradition (Lawful). Old knowledge keeps you alive
6Possession (Evil). Take what you can; it will sink later

Bonds

d6Bond
1My village depends on my knowledge.
2I guard a hidden cache in the reeds.
3A family member vanished into the marsh.
4I owe a debt to a folk healer.
5I keep a map no one else believes.
6I will protect the marsh from miners.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I assume betrayal first.
2I am slow to trust help.
3I sabotage outsiders out of fear.
4I hoard grudges.
5I avoid cities until forced.
6I underestimate 'civilized' dangers.

GM Notes

Marsh dwellers are perfect guides for southern travel, hidden ruins, and environmental hazards. Use poisoned water, forgotten settlements, and mining intrusions as recurring threats.

Related Pages

  • Quadling Country
  • Quadling
  • Lurline Old Ways
  • The Wizard Reign

character/backgrounds/emerald-city-urchi.title: Emerald City Urchin
character/backgrounds/emerald-city-urchi.content:
Emerald City Urchin

"The capital glitters. The gutters remember."

Overview

You grew up in the shadow of green glass and polished boots. You learned which streets the Palace watches, which markets feed you, and which smiles are traps.

Urchins become many things: thieves, informants, couriers, or saints. You became someone who can survive the city without believing its stories.

Applicable Races

This background is strongly tied to the Emerald City, but anyone could have been left there.

  • Emerald City Native: Born into the city's underside
  • Outlander: Stranded travelers' children
  • Munchkinlander: Runaways and refugees
  • The Touched: Targets of fear who learned to hide

Skill Proficiencies

Stealth, Sleight of Hand

Tool Proficiencies

Thieves' tools

Languages

None

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A length of wire or lockpick set
  • A hooded cloak with deep pockets
  • A lucky coin with the face rubbed off
  • A chalk stub for marking routes
  • A pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: Streetwise

You know where to find black markets, cheap shelter, and rumor brokers in a city. You can usually identify which gang or official controls a neighborhood and how to avoid them.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I can sleep through shouting.
2I assume everything is a deal.
3I keep my back to walls.
4I read hands before faces.
5I joke when afraid.
6I hate being pitied.
7I share food with kids automatically.
8I steal small things as a reflex.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Survival (Neutral). Stay alive; stay moving
2Loyalty (Good). Protect your own
3Freedom (Chaotic). No one owns me
4Fairness (Good). The rich should pay
5Caution (Lawful). Trust is expensive
6Greed (Evil). Take everything you can

Bonds

d6Bond
1A younger kid looks to me like a parent.
2I owe a gang boss for protection.
3A market vendor fed me when no one else did.
4I know a secret way into a government building.
5I keep a hidden stash for emergencies.
6I want revenge on a noble who hurt us.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I cannot stop lying.
2I pick pockets when bored.
3I refuse help out of pride.
4I start fights to test people.
5I hoard resources selfishly.
6I panic in quiet, clean rooms.

GM Notes

City urchins are perfect for urban campaigns: sewer routes, gang politics, Palace secrets, and street-level perspectives on big events. Use old friends, old debts, and sudden opportunities.

Related Pages

  • Emerald City
  • Criminal Networks
  • The Palace
  • The Agent

character/backgrounds/vinkus-tribal-exil.title: Vinkus Tribal Exile
character/backgrounds/vinkus-tribal-exil.content:
Vinkus Tribal Exile

"The Vinkus does not forgive. It only remembers."

Overview

You were part of a western tribal life shaped by hard wind, harder land, and older grudges. Then you were cast out - for a crime, a prophecy, a love, or the wrong kind of question.

Exile teaches resourcefulness and loneliness. You carry tribal customs like scars: visible to those who know, invisible to those who do not.

Applicable Races

This is primarily a Vinkan human background, though other exiles exist in theory.

  • Vinkan: Tribal members cast out or self-exiled
  • Outlander: Rare adoptees or foreign captives who fled
  • The Touched: Those labeled cursed and expelled
  • Winged Monkeys: Rarely, those who broke a handler's rule

Skill Proficiencies

Athletics, Survival

Tool Proficiencies

Navigator's tools (or none)

Languages

One of your choice

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A tribal token you are not supposed to keep
  • A weathered cloak suited to wind and sand
  • A small knife and whetstone
  • A waterskin
  • A pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: Hard Country Sense

You can find shelter, water, and routes through harsh terrain where others fail. You also recognize tribal signs, taboos, and negotiation rituals common in the Vinkus.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I distrust comfort.
2I test strangers before trusting them.
3I value courage over politeness.
4I sit with my back to the wind.
5I speak bluntly, even when it hurts.
6I miss my tribe more than I admit.
7I cannot stand being called 'civilized'.
8I carry shame like a charm.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Honor (Lawful). Keep your word or lose yourself
2Freedom (Chaotic). No tribe owns my fate
3Survival (Neutral). The land decides
4Justice (Good). Exile was wrong; I will prove it
5Tradition (Lawful). Old rules exist for a reason
6Dominance (Evil). Strength is the only law

Bonds

d6Bond
1I will return and be seen.
2Someone from my tribe hunts me.
3I protect a child or elder I traveled with.
4My exile began with a stolen object.
5I owe a debt to a Vinkus guide.
6I keep a song only my tribe knows.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I start fights to prove strength.
2I dismiss city folk as weak.
3I cannot admit fear.
4I hold grudges forever.
5I sabotage authority out of habit.
6I refuse compromise until too late.

GM Notes

Exiles bring westward plots: tribal politics, escort missions, and harsh travel. Use the exile's 'crime' as a mystery, and let the tribe's judgement be a looming shadow.

Related Pages

  • The Vinkus
  • Vinkan
  • Kiamo Ko
  • The Traveler

character/backgrounds/arjiki-royal-conne.title: Arjiki Royal Connection
character/backgrounds/arjiki-royal-conne.content:
Arjiki Royal Connection

"Royal blood is not magic. It just stains deeper."

Overview

You have ties to the Arjiki ruling family of the Vinkus: a cousin, a favored servant, a former lover, a courtier, or a child no one acknowledges in public.

Connection means access - and danger. Court life teaches you which smiles are knives and which knives are ceremonial.

Applicable Races

This is primarily a Vinkan human background with courtly reach.

  • Vinkan: The most common lineage and court culture
  • Outlander: Foreign courtiers and political marriages
  • Gillikinese: Scholars and envoys seeking influence
  • Emerald City Native: Imperial liaisons assigned west

Skill Proficiencies

History, Persuasion

Tool Proficiencies

Gaming set (cards or dice)

Languages

One of your choice

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A signet token or ribbon mark from the Arjiki court
  • A formal outfit and a travel cloak
  • A sealed letter you should not open
  • A small gift meant for a ruler
  • A pouch containing 15 gp

Feature: Courtly Pull

When dealing with Vinkus tribes and western courts, you can usually secure an audience with someone of status or gain safe passage - unless your name is currently out of favor.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I can flatter without sounding like flattery.
2I never show surprise.
3I remember every slight.
4I love luxury and resent it.
5I can spot a lie by posture.
6I make plans inside plans.
7I treat gifts like contracts.
8I am homesick for a place that used me.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Duty (Lawful). My house must endure
2Reform (Good). Power should be less cruel
3Prestige (Neutral). Status is safety
4Independence (Chaotic). I will not be owned by my bloodline
5Tradition (Lawful). Old hierarchies keep order
6Ruthlessness (Evil). Mercy is a weakness at court

Bonds

d6Bond
1Someone in the Arjiki court still loves me.
2I guard a scandal that could shatter the family.
3I owe my life to a bodyguard or retainer.
4I want to reclaim something stolen from the court.
5I carry a message meant for the ruler.
6My connection is my only inheritance.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I assume everyone wants something from me.
2I cannot stop politicking.
3I treat people as pieces on a board.
4I chase approval I claim to hate.
5I am reckless when insulted.
6I do not know how to live simply.

GM Notes

Use this background for western court intrigue, tribal politics, and empire-versus-local conflicts. A royal tie can open doors, but it also makes the character a target for leverage.

Related Pages

  • The Vinkus
  • Vinkan
  • Kiamo Ko
  • The Palace

character/backgrounds/colwen-grounds-ser.title: Colwen Grounds Servant
character/backgrounds/colwen-grounds-ser.content:
Colwen Grounds Servant

"In big houses, secrets collect like dust."

Overview

You served at Colwen Grounds, the Thropp estate: sweeping halls, carrying trays, hearing arguments you were never meant to hear. You learned the difference between public virtue and private fear.

The Thropps were not just a family - they were a storm that touched politics, religion, and rebellion. Even as 'just staff,' you stood close enough to get struck.

Applicable Races

Colwen staff were largely Munchkinlander humans, with a few outsiders employed for specialized work.

  • Munchkinlander: Local servants and laborers
  • Gillikinese: Hired tutors, clerks, and specialists
  • Emerald City Native: Officials' staff assigned as 'help'
  • Outlander: Hired hands who did not ask questions

Skill Proficiencies

Insight, Perception

Tool Proficiencies

Cook's utensils (or artisan tools)

Languages

None

Equipment

You start with the following equipment:

  • A plain uniform piece (apron, scarf, or cap)
  • A small ring of household keys (some no longer fit)
  • A sealed note you never delivered
  • A pocketknife
  • A pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: Servant's Ears

In noble or official spaces, you understand routines: when corridors are empty, how staff communicate, and where information leaks. You can usually blend into 'the help' long enough to overhear something useful.

Suggested Characteristics

People who lived this life often carry it in their habits, loyalties, and blind spots.

Personality Traits

d8Personality Trait
1I notice what people leave behind.
2I speak politely to avoid attention.
3I treat every room as a stage.
4I keep my opinions private.
5I am fiercely loyal to those who were kind.
6I am bitter about those who were not.
7I clean when anxious.
8I know how to disappear mid-conversation.

Ideals

d6Ideal
1Loyalty (Lawful). Protect the household - or what mattered in it
2Truth (Neutral). Someone has to know what happened
3Justice (Good). Masters should answer for harm
4Freedom (Chaotic). No one is born to serve
5Prudence (Neutral). Stay alive, stay quiet
6Resentment (Evil). I will poison their comfort

Bonds

d6Bond
1A Thropp family member spared me once.
2I witnessed something I cannot unsee.
3I promised to protect another servant.
4I kept an heirloom from the estate.
5I am hunted for what I heard.
6I still feel tied to that house.

Flaws

d6Flaw
1I eavesdrop compulsively.
2I struggle to speak up for myself.
3I sabotage authority indirectly.
4I resent the rich so much I misjudge allies.
5I lie to stay employed.
