adventures/the-witchs-wake/index.title: The Witch's Wake
adventures/the-witchs-wake/index.content:
The Witch's Wake

"Eight strangers. One inheritance. Seven seals. And dawn is thirteen hours away."

⚠️ GM CONTENT - Contains spoilers. Players should not read this page.

Adventure Overview

The Witch's Wake is a 4-hour gothic mystery one-shot for D&D 5e, set in Gregory Maguire's Oz. Eight players arrive at a remote estate, each believing they're heirs to the legendary witch Yackle's fortune. What begins as a competitive treasure hunt transforms into a desperate fight for survival—and ultimately, a confrontation with one of their own.

At a Glance

Detail Information
System D&D 5e
Duration 4 hours (single session)
Players 8 (one plays Yackle in disguise)
Level 5
Setting Gregory Maguire's Oz (Wicked series)
Location Yackle's Estate, Pertha Hills, Gillikin
Tone Gothic mystery, psychological horror, wonder (Haunting of Hill House meets Knives Out)
Key Themes Secrets, loneliness, the cost of immortality, identity

The Premise

What the Players Know

Eight strangers receive identical letters from the law offices of Trism & Associates in the Emerald City. Each letter states that the recipient has been named in the will of Yackle Ostreaga, a legendary witch who died (supposedly) a century ago. The letters provide travel arrangements to a remote estate in the Pertha Hills of Gillikin, where the will shall be read and the inheritance distributed.

Each player arrives with their own reason for being there:

  • A scholar seeking forbidden knowledge
  • A soldier claiming blood relation
  • A disguised Animal fleeing persecution
  • An ex-maunt seeking redemption
  • An Arjiki woman with bargained magic
  • A guilt-haunted military captain
  • A mechanical being questioning its existence
  • A widow (secretly Yackle herself)

Upon arrival, solicitor Mr. Trism reads the will: To claim the inheritance, the heirs must unlock seven seals hidden throughout the estate before dawn. The one who proves most worthy shall receive the greatest share.

What the Players Don't Know

This is not a competition—it's a ritual. Each player embodies an inversion of one of Lurline's Eight Bindings, the cosmic principles that give Oz its structure. Yackle needs their freely-given secrets to break these Bindings and achieve either dissolution (peace) or ascension (godhood).

And one of them—disguised as "Madame Viridian"—is Yackle herself.

The Core Twist

This adventure has two major twists:

The First Twist (End of Hour 1)

Trigger: The grandfather clock in the Foyer chimes thirteen times at midnight.

The Reveal: The inheritance isn't for one person—it's for all survivors. And the amount each receives increases with the number who survive. The competition was a lie. The house, now fully awakened, will try to kill them. They must work together to survive until dawn.

Effect: The players realize cooperation is survival. The house becomes actively hostile. Upper floors unlock. Lair actions begin.

The Second Twist (End of Hour 3)

Trigger: The seventh seal (Hunger) is completed in the Dining Room.

The Reveal: Madame Viridian drops her disguise. She is Yackle, and she's been among them the whole time, collecting their secrets. The seals weren't tests of worthiness—they were keys to breaking the Bindings. The final battle begins.

Effect: Betrayal, shock, and the transition from exploration to combat. Phase 1 of Yackle's boss fight begins.

Session Timeline

The adventure is structured into four distinct hours, each with specific goals, available content, and dramatic beats.

Hour 1: Arrival & Investigation (60 minutes)

Goal: Establish atmosphere, introduce characters, complete 2-3 seals, build mystery.

Key Events:

  • 0:00-0:15 — Players arrive individually at the estate. Brief introductions. Atmospheric descriptions of the grounds and cemetery.
  • 0:15-0:25 — Will reading in the Foyer. Mr. Trism explains the rules: seven seals, before dawn, prove your worth. He departs mysteriously.
  • 0:25-0:55 — Ground floor exploration. Players investigate rooms, discover lore, and attempt seals.
  • 0:55-1:00 — THE FIRST TWIST: Clock chimes thirteen times. Mr. Trism reappears (or his corpse is found). The truth is revealed: survive together or die separately. The house awakens.

Available Locations:

  • The Approach & Cemetery (Grounds)
  • The Foyer (entry point)
  • The Parlor
  • The Music Room (SEAL 1: MEMORY)
  • The Library (SEAL 3: NATURE)
  • The Chapel (SEAL 5: SACRIFICE)
  • The Kitchen
  • The Greenhouse

Seals Available: Memory, Nature, Sacrifice

Pacing Notes: Keep exploration brisk. Encourage players to split up initially (more suspicious, more discovery). Guide them toward at least 2 seals before the clock chimes. Foreshadow Yackle/Viridian's tells subtly.

Hour 2: Escalation & Cooperation (60 minutes)

Goal: First combat, team bonding, complete 3-4 more seals, deepen mystery.

Key Events:

  • 1:00-1:15 — Immediate aftermath of the First Twist. House becomes hostile. First lair action or combat encounter (animated furniture, memory shades, or house horror).
  • 1:15-1:30 — Players regroup, discuss strategy, share information. Yackle/Viridian positions herself as helpful ally, asking probing questions.
  • 1:30-1:55 — Upper floors now accessible. Continued exploration, seal completion, lore discovery. Puzzle box potentially found in Study.
  • 1:55-2:00 — Transition moment: players likely heading toward Dining Room for final seal, or discovering the cellar entrance.

Available Locations:

  • All ground floor rooms
  • The Dining Room (SEAL 7: HUNGER)
  • The Servant Quarters (SEAL 4: SERVICE - Part 1)
  • Portrait Gallery (SEAL 2: BLOOD) - Upper floor
  • Memorial Room (SEAL 4: SERVICE - Part 2) - Upper floor
  • Master Bedroom - Upper floor
  • Guest Rooms 1-3 (character-specific nightmare rooms) - Upper floor
  • The Nursery (Holly the ghost child) - Upper floor
  • Yackle's Study (puzzle box) - Upper floor
  • The Observatory - Upper floor
  • Hall of Mirrors (SEAL 6: DEED) - Upper floor

Seals Available: Blood, Service (both parts), Deed, Hunger

Pacing Notes: First combat should be challenging but winnable—establish stakes. Reward thorough exploration (special abilities from Holly, puzzle box, etc.). Build tension around secrets—Yackle should be present for at least 3-4 secret reveals by this point.

Hour 3: The Unraveling (45 minutes)

Goal: Complete final seal, trigger the reveal, begin boss fight Phase 1.

Key Events:

  • 2:00-2:15 — Final seal preparation. Likely in the Dining Room (Seal of Hunger). Players must openly acknowledge their wants/hungers.
  • 2:15-2:20 — THE SECOND TWIST: Seventh seal breaks. Yackle reveals herself. "How wonderful. You've made this so much easier." Madame Viridian's disguise drops. She manifests as herself.
  • 2:20-2:45 — PHASE 1 BATTLE: Yackle fights at full power (200 HP, or 100 HP if all seals completed). Uses collected secrets against the party. Tactical spellcasting, legendary actions, memory drain. Location: initially Dining Room, may move through upper floors.

Combat Location: Starts in Dining Room, can move throughout the house as Yackle uses dimension door and mobility.

Phase 1 Objectives:

  • Reduce Yackle to 100 HP or lower
  • Survive her Kumbric Extraction attempts
  • Deal with collected secret penalties
  • Trigger Phase 2 transition

Pacing Notes: The reveal should be a genuine shock—even if players suspected Viridian, the confirmation is dramatic. Give the Yackle player a moment to roleplay the transformation. Phase 1 combat should be intense—use legendary actions, lair actions, and secret-based abilities liberally. When Yackle reaches 100 HP, she merges with the house.

Hour 4: The Reckoning (45-55 minutes)

Goal: Chase through house to Heart Chamber, Phases 2-3 battle, resolution.

Key Events:

  • 2:45-3:00 — PHASE 2: THE CHASE. Yackle merges with the house, becomes omnipresent. Players must find and reach the Heart Chamber in the cellar. Lair actions intensify. Shifting geometry, animated threats, Yackle attacking from walls/floors/ceilings.
  • 3:00-3:30 — PHASE 3: THE HEART CHAMBER. Players reach the cellar, find the false wall (with or without map from puzzle box), enter Heart Chamber. They witness Yackle's true form suspended in the center. The Eighth Binding (Witness) cracks. Final battle begins. Destroy anchors, defeat Yackle in her true form.
  • 3:30-3:45 — RESOLUTION. Yackle is defeated through violence, mercy, or binding. The house's fate is determined. Epilogue: what happens to each character after they leave (or stay).

Combat Locations:

  • Phase 2: Throughout the house (chase sequence)
  • Wine Cellar (transition)
  • Main Cellar (approach)
  • Heart Chamber (Phase 3 finale)

Phase 2 Objectives:

  • Survive the house's lair actions
  • Find the Heart Chamber (map helps significantly)
  • Reach the cellar without being separated

Phase 3 Objectives:

  • Destroy the three anchor points (PAST, PRESENT, FUTURE)
  • Reduce Yackle to 0 HP, or
  • Negotiate peaceful dissolution, or
  • Volunteer to re-bind her as warden

Optional Phase 4: If all 8 secrets were collected, Yackle transforms into Ascendant form (CR 15, near-TPK scenario). This should be rare and represents the worst-case outcome.

Pacing Notes: Phase 2 should feel desperate and claustrophobic. Use lair actions every round. Phase 3 is the emotional climax—let Yackle be vulnerable, sympathetic, and tragic even as she fights to survive. The resolution should feel earned, whether through violence or mercy.

Key NPCs

Yackle (The Hidden Antagonist)

Disguise: Madame Viridian, a widow seeking restitution for her husband's death

Truth: A fragment of pre-creation chaos, trapped by the Binding of Witness for over a millennium

Goal: Collect the eight inversions (player secrets) to break the Bindings and achieve dissolution or ascension

Stat Block: Yackle (Full Stats)

Mr. Trism (The Solicitor)

Role: Reads the will, explains the rules, then disappears (or dies) when the First Twist occurs

Truth: Could be a construct created by the house, a previous heir's ghost, or a mundane lawyer who stumbles into danger. GM's choice based on tone preference.

Holly (The Ghost Child)

Location: The Nursery (upper floor)

Nature: Spirit of a 6-year-old girl who died 300 years ago. Daughter of Mira the cook. Doesn't fully understand she's dead.

Interaction: Kind, lonely, knows secrets about "the lady who changes." Can provide clues and warnings. Grants Guidance of the House ability to characters who treat her with kindness.

The Seven Seals

Each seal represents one of the Eight Bindings (the eighth seal is witnessing Yackle's true form). Completing seals grants individual rewards and weakens Yackle in the final battle. For complete mechanics, see The Seven Seals system page.

Seal Location Puzzle Reward
1. Memory Music Room Gather sheet music fragments, arrange them, play melody on piano Reroll Token (reroll one failed d20)
2. Blood Portrait Gallery Find portrait miniatures, place in correct family tree positions Death's Denial (auto-stabilize at 0 HP once)
3. Nature Library Identify which preserved creatures are Animals vs animals, speak their names True Sight Token (advantage on one Insight check)
4. Service Servant Quarters + Memorial Room Notice stuck bell, go to Memorial Room, light candle, speak names of the dead Swift Aid (Help as bonus action for session)
5. Sacrifice Chapel Place something of genuine personal value in offering bowl Last Strike (attack when dropped to 0 HP)
6. Deed Hall of Mirrors Stand before True Mirror, say aloud "That is me. I did that." Resolve Token (reroll one failed save)
7. Hunger Dining Room All characters seated, each openly acknowledges a genuine want/hunger Second Wind (recover one Hit Die)
8. Witness Heart Chamber Witness Yackle's true form (automatic when entering chamber) Final Binding broken; Yackle becomes vulnerable

Seal Mastery: If all 7 seals are completed before defeating Yackle, each seal grants an additional bonus against her in combat. Most importantly: Yackle starts Phase 1 at half HP (100 instead of 200).

Special Discoveries

Beyond the seals, players can earn powerful abilities through thorough exploration:

Ability How Earned Effect
Flash of Genius Solve the ILOVEU puzzle box in Study Reaction: Add +5 to any ability check or save within 30 ft. 3 uses total.
Guidance of the House Help Holly the ghost child in the Nursery Bonus action: Grant d4 to ally's next check. Unlimited uses. Holly whispers warnings.
Inspiration of the Fallen Read names of previous heirs aloud respectfully in Memorial Room Once per session, add 1d6 to any d20 roll.
Lurline's Word Inside the puzzle box in Study Speak the Word to deal 4d10 radiant damage to Yackle. Once, no save.
Unmaking Phrase Piece together Bindings lore from multiple sources Stun Yackle for 1 round. Once, no save.
Anchor Knowledge Find the map in the puzzle box Know exact location of Heart Chamber and anchor points in Phase 3.

Possible Endings

The adventure can conclude in several ways, depending on player choices and actions:

1. Violence (Combat Victory)

Outcome: Yackle is reduced to 0 HP in Phase 3 (or Phase 4). She crumbles to dust with final words: "I only wanted... to see tomorrow." The house immediately begins collapsing. Players have 3 rounds to escape or take 10d10 bludgeoning damage per round buried in rubble.

Aftermath: The estate is destroyed. Whatever inheritance existed is lost. But the players survive, each carrying a piece of Yackle's story. The Eighth Binding remains broken in this location—strange things happen in the Pertha Hills now.

2. Mercy (Peaceful Dissolution)

Outcome: In Phase 3, players show Yackle genuine compassion and offer her a peaceful end. Requires DC 20 Persuasion or Insight check and sincere roleplaying. Yackle, finally witnessed and understood, chooses to let go. She fades peacefully, not into death but into gentle dissolution.

Aftermath: The house becomes mundane—no longer sentient, but stable. It can be explored, and a genuine inheritance (books, artifacts, Yackle's accumulated wealth) can be claimed. The players leave changed, having given an ancient suffering being the gift of peace.

3. Re-Binding (Sacrificial Warden)

Outcome: A player volunteers to stay as the house's warden, binding Yackle but keeping her alive. The volunteer becomes the new keeper, living in the estate, maintaining the binding, and preventing Yackle's return to active malevolence.

Aftermath: Bittersweet. The volunteer sacrifices freedom but gains purpose. The house remains sentient, Yackle remains trapped but alive. The other players leave with their shares of the inheritance. The warden can become an NPC for future campaigns—a contact, quest-giver, or tragic figure.

4. Ascension (Phase 4 - TPK Risk)

Outcome: If all 8 secrets were collected, Yackle transforms into her Ascendant form (CR 15). The party faces a near-impossible battle. If they manage to win, Yackle shatters with a reality-breaking scream: "I will return... I will always return..." The house collapses violently.

Aftermath: Even in victory, this ending is dark. Yackle's last words suggest she may reform eventually. The Bindings are fundamentally damaged. Reality in the area becomes unstable. Players escape but at great cost (possibly with casualties).

5. Failure (TPK)

Outcome: The party is defeated. Yackle consumes their secrets and life force. She achieves her goal and either dissolves (if she wanted oblivion) or ascends (if she wanted power).

Aftermath: If running this as a campaign prelude, have the TPK be canon. The next campaign begins with a new party investigating why eight people vanished in the Pertha Hills. The house still stands. Something ancient waits inside.

Running the Adventure

Pre-Session Preparation

Essential Reading:

  • This adventure index (overview and timeline)
  • Yackle's Estate (all 22 rooms)
  • Yackle (stat block and tactics)
  • The Seven Seals (puzzle mechanics)
  • The Eight Bindings (cosmology)

Materials Needed:

  • 12 physical handouts (see Handouts section below)
  • ILOVEU puzzle box (or representation)
  • Music box prop (optional)
  • Initiative tracker for 8 players + Yackle + lair actions
  • Secret collection tracker (mark which secrets Yackle has collected)
  • Estate map for reference (or hand-drawn version)

Player Briefing:

  • Select one player to play Yackle (choose someone comfortable with secret antagonist roles)
  • Provide that player with separate Yackle briefing document (roleplay guidance, tells to show, secret collection tracking)
  • Provide all players with their character sheets, emphasizing their secrets
  • Set expectations: gothic mystery, 4 hours, character secrets matter, cooperation required after Hour 1

Pacing Guidance

Use a visible timer. Let players know how much real-time has elapsed. This creates natural urgency.

Hour 1: Leisurely. Let players explore, roleplay introductions, examine rooms thoroughly. Guide them toward 2-3 seals but don't rush.

Hour 2: Moderate. First combat sets stakes. Keep exploration moving but reward thoroughness. 3-4 more seals completed.

Hour 3: Urgent. The reveal is dramatic—give it space. Phase 1 combat is intense. Use legendary actions every round.

Hour 4: Desperate. Time pressure is real. Phase 2 chase should feel claustrophobic. Phase 3 is cathartic. Resolution is earned.

If running long: Condense Phase 2—have players find the Heart Chamber more quickly. Simplify lair actions.

If running short: Extend exploration in Hour 2. Add additional character-specific nightmare rooms or encounters.

Tracking Secrets

This is critical. Yackle (and you as GM) must track which secrets have been revealed in her presence:

Character Secret Collected? Combat Benefit
Averic Forged the letters from his mentor ☐ Disadvantage on Int saves; counter 1 spell free
Liir False Ostrega blood claim ☐ Advantage on attacks vs him; his damage -1d6
Frederick Actually an Animal (Fox) ☐ Dominate person once, no concentration
Shell Cast out for discovering maunt corruption ☐ Resistance to radiant; Shell's heals heal Yackle 25%
Sarima Magic comes from void bargain, not heritage ☐ Use Sarima's spell slots; Sarima disadv. on concentration
Mareth Burned Red Clay Fork village, killed 143 children ☐ Disadvantage on attacks vs her; crits become normal
Seven Feels emotions despite being mechanical ☐ Skip Seven's turn once; disadv. on Wis saves

Mark each secret as collected when revealed in Yackle/Viridian's presence. Use these benefits in combat immediately.

Handouts

Physical handouts greatly enhance immersion. For detailed handout content, see the Handouts page (Task 6, to be created). Brief list:

  1. Place Cards (Foyer): 8 cards with epithets describing each character's inversion
  2. Gravestone Rubbing (Cemetery): Ostrega family crest and dates
  3. The Ozma Gambit (Parlor): Note about the unfinished chess game
  4. Sheet Music Fragments (Music Room): 4-5 pieces spelling "REMEMBER"
  5. Journal Excerpts (Library): Three entries from years 347, 612, 901 OZ
  6. Eight Windows Diagram (Chapel): Visual guide to the Eight Bindings
  7. Recipe Card (Kitchen): "For the Long Night" cryptic recipe
  8. Names of the Lost (Memorial Room): List of previous heirs
  9. Unfinished Letter (Master Bedroom): "I want U to know..." with circled U
  10. Family Tree (Portrait Gallery): Incomplete Ostrega genealogy
  11. Recent Journal Entry (Study): Yackle's plan from year 954
  12. Previous Heir's Journal (Cellar): Warning from someone who came before

Common Pitfalls & Solutions

Pitfall: Players suspect Viridian immediately and isolate/kill her before the reveal.

Solution: Yackle should play Viridian subtly—warm, helpful, curious. Not suspicious. If players do isolate her, have her escape using dimension door or misty step, then trigger the reveal early (Hour 2 instead of Hour 3). Adjust accordingly.

Pitfall: Players don't reveal secrets voluntarily.

Solution: Use Kumbric Extraction in combat to force revelations. Have room-specific encounters that pressure secrets (Guest Rooms, Hall of Mirrors). Yackle can also extract during Phase 1.

Pitfall: Party splits up and gets picked off one by one.

Solution: After the First Twist, emphasize survival through cooperation. Have early encounters punish solo exploration (animated objects, memory shades). Reward grouping up.

Pitfall: Combat runs too long, session goes over 4 hours.

Solution: Use lair actions on initiative count 20 only (not 20 and 10). Reduce Phase 2 HP to 150 instead of 180. Simplify Phase 3 by removing one anchor.

Pitfall: Players find the puzzle box immediately and get the map—skip Phase 2 chase.

Solution: This is fine! Reward smart play. Phase 2 can be shorter. Or add complication: the map is in code, requires translating symbols using Chapel windows.

Adapting for Fewer Players

This adventure is designed for 8 players but can be adapted:

6-7 Players: Simply use fewer character inversions. Yackle needs at least 5-6 to weaken the Bindings. Remove 1-2 characters (usually Liir and/or Mareth).

4-5 Players: Significant changes needed. Remove Yackle as player character—she's purely NPC. Players are all legitimate heirs. Reduce Yackle's HP by 25%. Remove Phase 4 entirely. Focus on mystery and exploration over betrayal.

2-3 Players: Not recommended. The player betrayal twist doesn't work with so few. Consider running this as a different adventure—perhaps the players are investigators hired to find out what happened to eight missing heirs.

Related Pages

  • Yackle's Estate - All 22 rooms with detailed descriptions
  • Yackle - Complete stat blocks for all 4 phases
  • The Seven Seals - Puzzle mechanics and rewards
  • The Eight Bindings - Cosmological lore
  • Handouts - 12 physical handouts (to be created)
  • GM Quick Reference - One-page cheat sheet (to be created)
  • Pregenerated Characters - 8 character sheets with secrets

adventures/the-witchs-wake/quick-referen.title: GM Quick Reference — The Witch's Wake
adventures/the-witchs-wake/quick-referen.content:
The Witch's Wake — GM Quick Reference

"Everything you need to run this 4-hour gothic mystery in one place."

⚠️ GM ONLY — This page contains major spoilers for The Witch's Wake adventure.

At a Glance

  • System: D&D 5e
  • Duration: 4 hours
  • Players: 8 (one is secretly Yackle)
  • Level: 5
  • Setting: Yackle's Estate, Pertha Hills, Gillikin
  • Tone: Gothic mystery, horror, intrigue (Haunting of Hill House meets Knives Out)

The Core Premise

Eight strangers are summoned to the remote estate of Yackle Ostreaga, legendary witch thought long dead. They're told they're heirs who must unlock seven seals to claim their inheritance. One of them is secretly Yackle herself in disguise, collecting their secrets to fuel a dark ritual.

The Two Twists

  1. End of Hour 1: The inheritance increases with more survivors. The house becomes hostile. Cooperation is survival.
  2. End of Hour 3: One player IS Yackle. She's been collecting secrets. Final battle begins.

Session Timeline

Hour Phase Key Events Goal
1 Arrival • Players arrive individually (0:00-0:15)
• Will reading in Foyer (0:15-0:25)
• Free exploration begins (0:25-0:55)
• FIRST TWIST: Clock chimes 13 times (0:55-1:00) 		Establish atmosphere, introduce characters, complete 2-3 seals
2 Escalation • First combat encounter (1:00-1:15)
• Upper floors unlock (1:15-1:25)
• Major lore discovery (1:25-1:50)
• Players start suspecting each other (1:50-2:00) 		Build tension, complete 3-4 more seals, reveal deeper mysteries
3 Unraveling • Final seal attempted (2:00-2:20)
• Gathering evidence (2:20-2:35)
• THE REVEAL: Viridian is Yackle (2:35-2:45)
• Phase 1 battle begins (2:45-3:00) 		Build to revelation, create dramatic confrontation
4 Reckoning • Phase 2: House chase (3:00-3:20)
• Phase 3: Heart Chamber (3:20-3:50)
• Resolution & epilogue (3:50-4:00) 		Epic multi-phase boss battle, narrative conclusion

The Eight Secrets

Character Binding Secret Combat Effect (If Collected)
Averic (Scholar) Memory Forged his mentor's letters Disadvantage on Int saves; Yackle counters one spell free
Liir (Heir) Blood Knows his Ostrega claim is false Yackle has advantage on attacks vs him; his damage -1d6
Frederick (Animal) Nature Is a Fox Animal passing as human Yackle can cast Dominate Person on him (no concentration)
Mareth (Debt-Holder) Service Murdered the person she owed a life-debt to Yackle's necrotic damage bypasses his resistance/immunity
Shell (Former Maunt) Sacrifice Stole sacred relic to save own life Yackle can force him to reroll any save (use lower result)
Nessa (Widow) Deed Killed her husband and framed another Disadvantage on Wisdom saves; Yackle's Insight vs her is advantage
Trism (Veteran) Hunger Killed prisoners for their rations during siege Yackle heals for half damage she deals to him
Viridian (Secret) Witness IS YACKLE — has never been truly known If all 7 other secrets collected: Phase 4 Ascension (CR 15, near-TPK)
Critical Rule: Yackle only collects a secret if it's revealed in her presence (within 30 feet). Once revealed to her, that character is immune to Memory Extraction.

The Seven Seals

Seal Location Puzzle Individual Reward Mastery Bonus (Combat)
1. Memory Music Room Reconstruct & play melody from fragments Reroll Token (force Yackle to reroll) Force Yackle to reroll 1 attack/check per round
2. Blood Portrait Gallery Complete family tree using portraits Death's Denial (auto-stabilize at 0 HP once) Yackle's necrotic damage halved
3. Nature Library Identify which books describe Animals vs animals True Sight Token (see invisible/shapechangers) Yackle cannot teleport or turn invisible
4. Service Servant Quarters → Memorial Answer servant's bell, light memorial candle Swift Aid (Dash as bonus action 3x) Party gains +2 to initiative
5. Sacrifice Chapel Offer something precious to altar, ritual prayer Martyr's Shield (transfer damage to self) Party gains resistance to necrotic damage
6. Deed Hall of Mirrors Confront true reflection, accept past actions Clear Conscience (advantage on Wis saves) Yackle's illusions/charms have disadvantage
7. Hunger Dining Room Resist phantom feast, break plates together Satiation (no exhaustion for 24 hours) Yackle cannot regain HP or legendary actions
All Seals Complete Bonus: If all 7 seals are completed, Yackle starts Phase 1 at HALF HP (100 instead of 200).

Combat: Yackle's Phases

Phase 1: The Revealed Witch (CR 9)

  • HP: 200 (or 100 if all seals complete)
  • AC: 15
  • Location: Wherever revelation happens (usually Dining Room or Observatory)
  • Tactics: Memory Extraction (bonus action), spellcasting, collecting remaining secrets
  • Legendary Actions: 3 base + 1 per secret collected
  • Trigger Phase 2: Reduced to 0 HP

Phase 2: The House Itself (CR 10)

  • HP: 150
  • AC: 16
  • Form: Incorporeal, merged with the house
  • Location: Entire mansion
  • Tactics: Lair actions every round, animate furniture/portraits, separate party
  • Win Condition: Players must reach Heart Chamber (basement)
  • Trigger Phase 3: Players enter Heart Chamber

Phase 3: The Heart Chamber (CR 11)

  • HP: 175
  • AC: 17
  • Form: Anchored to three ritual points
  • Anchors: 30 HP each (destroy anchors = -20 HP to Yackle & -1 legendary action)
  • Tactics: Full power, desperate, willing to destroy the house
  • Defeat: Death OR players convince her to accept oblivion (DC 20 Persuasion/Insight)

Phase 4: Ascendant (CR 15) — ONLY IF ALL 8 SECRETS COLLECTED

  • HP: 250
  • AC: 18
  • Warning: Near-TPK scenario. Yackle becomes partially unbound.
  • Each secret grants one "Eight Inversion Attack" (4d10 damage, special effect)
  • How to survive: Players must find the Unmaking Phrase (hidden in lore) or sacrifice Viridian's player willingly

Key NPCs

Mr. Trism (The Solicitor)

  • Role: Reads the will, delivers exposition, maintains normalcy
  • Secret: Dead. Killed by Yackle 3 days ago, reanimated as puppet
  • Tell: Never eats, never drinks, eyes don't blink properly
  • Investigation DC 14: Notice he's unusually cold to touch
  • When to Reveal: When Yackle reveals herself, Trism collapses like strings cut

Holly (Ghost Child)

  • Who: Spirit of Yackle's daughter from centuries ago
  • Location: Nursery, occasionally wanders
  • Personality: Innocent, playful, doesn't understand she's dead
  • What She Knows: "Mama has so many faces," location of hidden rooms, puzzle box code letters
  • Help: Can guide players to Heart Chamber if befriended

Critical Mechanics

Memory Extraction (Yackle's Bonus Action)

Target one creature within 30 feet. Wisdom save DC 16 or Yackle learns one secret memory. If the memory is one of the Eight Inversions, she collects it for power.

Immunity: Once a character has willingly revealed their secret to Yackle (roleplay, not extraction), they're immune to this ability.

Lair Actions (Phase 2)

On initiative count 20, Yackle uses one lair action. Cannot repeat the last one used.

  • Grasping Walls: DC 15 Str save or restrained
  • Shifting Corridors: Teleport one creature to random room
  • Memory Flood: DC 15 Wis save or stunned (relive victim's memory)
  • Summon Shade: Memory Shade (CR 3) appears
  • Collapsing Floor: DC 15 Dex save or 3d6 damage, fall prone
  • Extinguish: All magical light in one room snuffed

The Puzzle Box: I L O V E U

Six-letter code hidden throughout the house. Letters found in:

  • I — Portrait Gallery (carved in frame)
  • L — Library (journal entry circled)
  • O — Music Room (sheet music title first letters)
  • V — Chapel (altar inscription)
  • E — Greenhouse (arrangement of dead flowers)
  • U — Master Bedroom (circled in unfinished letter)

Reward when solved:

  • Map to Heart Chamber
  • Lurline's Word scroll (4d10 radiant damage, no save, one use)
  • Flash of Genius ability (add Int mod to save/check, 3 uses)

Discovery Abilities

Special powers players can earn through exploration and roleplay:

Ability How to Earn Effect

Possible Endings

1. Total Victory

Condition: All 7 seals complete, defeat Yackle, most players survive
Outcome: House becomes neutral safe haven. Players inherit estate and Yackle's knowledge. Bindings remain intact.

2. Pyrrhic Victory

Condition: Defeat Yackle but 4+ players dead, OR Yackle reaches Phase 4 but is stopped
Outcome: House collapses. Survivors escape barely. Estate destroyed but Oz is saved.

3. Mercy

Condition: Players convince Yackle to accept oblivion (DC 20 Persuasion/Insight check)
Outcome: Yackle disperses peacefully. House fades. Players each receive a gift from her final act of sacrifice. Bittersweet.

4. The Unmaking (BAD END)

Condition: Yackle collects all 8 secrets and isn't stopped in Phase 4
Outcome: The Eight Bindings begin to fray. Reality around the estate becomes unstable. Yackle achieves oblivion but takes a piece of Oz with her. The Pertha Hills become a "blighted zone" where the rules of reality don't fully apply. Survivors flee, traumatized.

5. Stalemate

Condition: Players escape house before defeating Yackle, OR all players die
Outcome: Yackle remains trapped. In another century, she'll call new heirs. The cycle continues.

Common GM Pitfalls & Solutions

Pitfall: Players suspect Viridian too early

Solution: Have Yackle/Viridian share a "secret" that's emotionally true (her loneliness, her exhaustion) even if the backstory is false. Make her sympathetic. Red herring another player with suspicious behavior.

Pitfall: Players refuse to share secrets

Solution: Yackle can use Memory Extraction (Wis save DC 16). Seals require vulnerability to complete. House horrors threaten them individually, forcing cooperation.

Pitfall: Combat takes too long

Solution: Phase 2 is a chase, not full combat. Phase 3 starts with anchors pre-damaged if time is short. Skip Phase 2 entirely if running behind.

Pitfall: Players get lost in 22 rooms

Solution: Ghost child guides them. Seal locations glow faintly (Perception DC 12). Map handout shows rough layout.

Pitfall: Too many secrets revealed early

Solution: Yackle must be present (within 30 feet) to collect. She'll engineer situations to be nearby when secrets might emerge.

Pacing Guidelines

  • If ahead of schedule: Add more atmospheric exploration, deeper NPC roleplay, extra house horror encounters
  • If behind schedule: Skip Phase 2 chase, start Phase 3 with anchors damaged, reduce HP pools by 25%
  • If party is struggling: Holly offers direct help, discovery abilities become easier to find, reduce DCs by 2
  • If party is dominating: Yackle collects secrets faster, adds more lair actions, uses environment creatively
